intro: Linosyris vulgaris, commonly known as the common linosyris, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head. The plant is native to parts of Europe and Asia and thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has a hairy stem and is often found in disturbed areas due to its adaptability. Linosyris vulgaris is primarily a herbaceous perennial, with a life cycle that includes flowering and seed production during the summer months.
